intro: Seseli asperulum, commonly known as rough seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli asperulum is often found in open woodlands and along coastal areas.
